metadata.name: Homebase - Wide Format Vista
metadata.description:
18,643 x 6,761 pixels
Canon EOS 5D mkiv
Canon EF 70-200mm F/2.8 IS II USM
1/2sec, f/11, ISO 100
6 vertical exposures

Reduced to 9,000  pixels to meet 50mb file size restriction.

Image by: David Lennard

About 100,000 acres of the Centennials are roadless. This includes National Forest lands, the Bureau of Land Management's Centennial Mountains Primitive Area, a portion of Red Rock Lakes National Wildlife Refuge, state and private land, and part of a USDA Agricultural Research Station for sheep. Around 326 vascular plant species have been identified in the Centennials, an unusual plant diversity for the Yellowstone region. Grizzly bears inhabit the area, as nearly all species indigenous to the Greater Yellowstone Ecosystem.
